intro: Kreysigia tripladenia, commonly known as the three-leafed sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Kreysigia tripladenia is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its botanical structure supports its role as a hardy, drought-tolerant species in its native habitat.
